How I debug ruby code

09 April 2010

Debugging code is so important. I would like to share my ways. Enjoy:)

1. put in anywhere of the code need to debug
puts something

it will output something into logs. This is the basic way but very easy, further more you can use tap to make it easier.


2.later I wrote a method in lib/my_puts.rb like

def gp(s = "")
  puts "\n\n<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<"
  puts s
  puts "<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<\n\n"
end

and put into enviroment.rb
require 'my_puts'

So in Rails enviroment, use

pg "I am strong"

will output
<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<< I am strong <<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<

It make the debug info more easy to be found.


3.Debugger is the final debug solution. It even can be use in writing test code or rake task.

Just puts debugger in your code. Most useful commands in ruby-debug

  • list
  • irb
  • p

Do not forget to delete the debugger afterward:)


4.Of course, if use TDD or BDD and meeting 100% code coverage, no need debug any more.
